thread.title: Jon Desir had huge three-play sequence in Towson football's 28-21 upset of No. 23 Villanova
thread.title_full: Jon Desir had huge three-play sequence in Towson football's 28-21 upset of No. 23 Villanova

author: Edward Lee
title: Jon Desir had huge three-play sequence in Towson football's 28-21 upset of No. 23 Villanova
text:
Edward Lee Contact Reporter The Baltimore Sun Hands team: In three straight plays, Jon Desir used his mitts to help Towson football beat Villanova. 
Jon Desir had a season-high nine tackles in Towson’s 28-21 upset of No. 23 Villanova on Saturday night, but the redshirt senior defensive end really shone during a three-play sequence in the second quarter at Johnny Unitas Stadium. 
With the Tigers (4-3, 2-2 Colonial Athletic Association) clinging to a 12-7 lead, the Wildcats (3-4, 2-2) marched deep into Towson territory. 
On second-and-8 at the 13-yard line, redshirt freshman quarterback Zach Bednarczyk dropped back and attempted a pass to a receiver in the left flat. Desir batted down his throw at the line of scrimmage. 
On the next play, Bednarczyk took another three-step drop and tried a pass to his left, and again, Desir got a hand in the passing lane. 
On fourth down, freshman kicker Gerald Smith lined up for a 30-yard field-goal attempt, but Desir’s outstretched arm deflected it wide right and the Tigers entered halftime up five, not two.
